Headline: The Brand Architect | Ex-Meta | Emotion Is the New Algorithm
Comment:
Absolutely agree, Dilip Kumar. The real moat for India in Deeptech will come from bridging three gaps simultaneously, patient capital, cross-disciplinary talent, and market validation at scale.

1Ô∏è‚É£ Capital Gap: Deeptech isn‚Äôt a 12-month ROI play, we need investors with a 7-10 year horizon, similar to biotech or space ventures. (Rainmatter by Zerodha may solve this)

2Ô∏è‚É£ Talent Gap: Encourage academia‚Äìindustry labs to work like startups, where researchers are incentivised to commercialise their IP.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Adoption Gap: Partner with large Indian enterprises to become first-market customers for Deeptech solutions, reducing the ‚Äúvalley of death‚Äù between prototype and profitability.

If we align these three, India will create its own next wave.
processed_comment: absolutely agree dilip kumar the real moat for india in deeptech will come from bridging three gaps simultaneously patient capital crossdisciplinary talent and market validation at scale capital gap deeptech isnt a month roi play we need investors with a year horizon similar to biotech or space ventures rainmatter by zerodha may solve this talent gap encourage academiaindustry labs to work like startups where researchers are incentivised to commercialise their ip adoption gap partner with large indian enterprises to become firstmarket customers for deeptech solutions reducing the valley of death between prototype and profitability if we align these three india will create its own next wave

Headline: Research Analyst | Writing on Business Models & Sustainability | Featured in LinkedIn News
Comment:
Completely agree on the deeptech imperative! India's quantum computing initiative (‚Çπ6,000+ crore National Quantum Mission) and defense-tech ecosystem are perfect examples of where we need to build indigenous capabilities now.
From my research tracking 30+ defense startups and quantum-safe infrastructure needs, the key areas I see are: 
Post-quantum cryptography (critical for fintech like Zerodha) 
AI-powered defense systems with dual civilian applications
Indigenous semiconductor and quantum hardware capabilities
Happy to share insights from my deeptech research - especially on companies building quantum-resistant security solutions and AI applications for critical infrastructure. The intersection of defense-tech and fintech security is particularly fascinating.

Headline: Co-founder @ Zennoia | At the Intersection of Data, Startups, and Venture Capital
Comment:
This is the most important conversation for the Indian ecosystem right now Dilip Kumar. 
The biggest challenge for Deeptech isn't a lack of talent, it's the nature of the capital required. Blitzscaling VC money built consumer apps. Deeptech needs patient, long-term capital that understands deep R&D cycles.
